result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenan G Newton

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

2:36 PM Defendant Kenan G Newton in court.  ADA Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defn has been found eligible for SPD and is awaiting an appointment of attorney. Defn has previously waived time limits. STC scheduled.
Drug Court packet sent to defendant at DCJ to be returned to JMH if defendant is still interested in drug court.

- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Trial Judge - Br 2

3:04 PM Defendant Kenan G Newton in court, in custody.  Attorney Devonte D Windham in court for Kenan G Newton.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Arguments by parties. Defendant referred for screening.
Status conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on October 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenan G Newton
Current: 1819 Aberg Ave, Madison, WI 53704 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 240 Ohio St, c/o DOC, Oshkosh, WI 54902 United States
Notice of intent to certify debt to the WI department of revenue returned undeliverable; unable to forward
Def's Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture returned - Attempted - Not known/unable to forward
Def's Judgment of Bail/Bond Forfeiture returned - Attempted - not know/unable to forward
03:14 PM Defendant did not appear.  Tomas Fernando Valerio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference on July 25, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall report to the Dane County Jail to complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to the next in-person court hearing or the conclusion of the case. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 2 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

ADDRESS INFO for Kenan G Newton
Current: 240 Ohio St, c/o DOC, Oshkosh, WI 54902 United States  (Effective: 05-12-2022)
Prior: 1819 Aberg Ave D, Madison, WI 53704

11:07 AM Defendant appeared.  Frank John Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
